Class Flower

  • java.lang.Object
    • Flower

  • public class Flower
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Flower(java.lang.String colour, java.lang.String species, int mAge, double mHeight)
      Create a new flower.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Flower clone() 
      void die()
      The flower dies due to external circumstances, such as being eaten by a caterpillar.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      double getAge()
      Return the flower's age.
      java.lang.String getColour() 
      double getHeight()
      Height is determined by the following formula: H = (2/pi) * tan^-1(age/maxHeight) * maxHeight
      java.lang.String getSpecies() 
      boolean grow()
      The flower grows, increasing its age by 1.
      boolean growInside(Pot p)
      For each free space inside the pot, the flower grows an additional 0.5 units, up to a maximum of 2.5 units additional.
      It still grows by a base of 1 each time, so the total maximum growth is 3.5.
      Dead flowers cannot grow anymore.
      boolean isAlive()
      Check if the flower is alive.

        finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Flower

        public Flower(java.lang.String colour,
              java.lang.String species,
              int mAge,
              double mHeight)
        Create a new flower. Colour and species comparisons should be case insensitive. Age is initially 0.
        Parameters:
        colour -
        species -
        mAge - If age is negative, then the flower is already dead.
        mHeight -

    • Method Detail

      • grow

        public boolean grow()
        The flower grows, increasing its age by 1. If it reaches its max age or beyond, it dies. Dead flowers cannot grow anymore.
        Returns:
        true if the flower is still alive, false if it died or is already dead

      • growInside

        public boolean growInside(Pot p)
        For each free space inside the pot, the flower grows an additional 0.5 units, up to a maximum of 2.5 units additional.
        It still grows by a base of 1 each time, so the total maximum growth is 3.5.
        Dead flowers cannot grow anymore.
        Parameters:
        p - The pot which this flower is growing inside.
        Returns:
        true if the flower is still alive, false if it died or is already dead

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Check if the flower is alive.
        Returns:
        whether the flower is alive or not

      • getColour

        public java.lang.String getColour()
        Returns:
        The flower's colour

      • getSpecies

        public java.lang.String getSpecies()
        Returns:
        The flower's species

      • getAge

        public double getAge()
        Return the flower's age. If the flower died due to external circumstances, return -1. Otherwise, if the flower died naturally, return the age it was at when it died (this is a value greater than maxAge).
        Returns:
        The flower's age

      • getHeight

        public double getHeight()
        Height is determined by the following formula: H = (2/pi) * tan^-1(age/maxHeight) * maxHeight
        Returns:
        The flower's height

      • die

        public void die()
        The flower dies due to external circumstances, such as being eaten by a caterpillar.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • clone

        public Flower clone()
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
